ygData.subject: twitter crawling

I am trying to crawl twitter to get a search query
http://search.twitter.co=
m/search?q=3Dsotomayor 
as part of a new collection that the Library of Con=
gress is doing on the supreme court nominations.  Intent is to do a daily c=
rawl to capture the tweets about sotomayor.

Twitter provides up to 100 pag=
es of what has been tweeted about the query term.  Unfortunately, the max-i=
d for the additional 99 pages always start with the number of the latest tw=
eet on the fly so I can't really specify that because I have to be concerne=
d with users accessing it via wayback as part of the collection.


I am try=
ing to maximize the efficiency of this crawl, limiting the extraneous stuff=
.

My surt prefix associations are
http://(com,twitter,search,)/search?max_=
id=3D 
http://(com,twitter,search,)/search?q=3Dsotomayor 

Using the standa=
rd global sheet for deep seed crawl.

Is this the best way to do this crawl=
?  And yes, Gordon, Heritrix rel. 2.

suggestions on the sheet settings?
I =
am getting a lot of garbage.
